starwars

Class SWAffordance

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Action
      • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Affordance
        • starwars.SWAffordance
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionInterface, java.lang.Comparable<ActionInterface>, SWActionInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Attack, Dip, Disassemble, Disowned, Fill, Healing, Leave, MindControl, Owned, Repair, Take, Train

    public abstract class SWAffordance
extends Affordance
implements SWActionInterface
    Class that represents Affordances in the starwars world.

    This class implements such methods in SWActionInterface as can reasonably be written at this stage, to minimize the amount of work that needs to be done to add new Affordances.

    Author:
    ram
    See Also:
    Affordance, SWActionInterface

    • Constructor Detail

      • SWAffordance

        public SWAffordance(SWEntityInterface theTarget,
                    MessageRenderer m)
        Constructor for the SWAffordance. This would initialize the MessageRenderer and the target for this SWAffordance.
        Parameters:
        theTarget - a sub class of SWEntityInterface on which the action needs to be performed on
        m - the messageRenderer to display messages for this SWAffordance.

    • Method Detail

      • isMoveCommand

        public boolean isMoveCommand()
        Returns if or not this SWAffordance is a move command. By default, SWAffordances are not move commands hence this method will always return false.

        This method needs to be overridden in any SWAffordance is a move command (i.e. must be overridden to return true if the action can potentially change the location of a SWEntity or SWActor).

        Specified by:
        isMoveCommand in interface SWActionInterface
        Returns:
        false

      • getDuration

        public int getDuration()
        Description copied from interface: ActionInterface
        Returns the length of time the Action will take. This can be longer or shorter than the duration of a tick, but even if it is shorter than half a tick, the Actor performing it doesn't get an extra move. If you want Actors to be able to act more than once in a turn, have your turns comprise more than one tick.

        The Scheduler uses this method to determine the order in which Actions will be completed. Actions of short duration complete before Actions of long duration.

        Specified by:
        getDuration in interface ActionInterface
        Specified by:
        getDuration in class Action
        Returns:
        the length of time an Action takes
        See Also:
        Scheduler

      • execute

        public void execute(Actor<?> actor)
        Execute this SWAffordance by calling the act() method with an Actor a to perform the SWAffordance.

        This method acts as a wrapper for the act() method that downcasts its parameter to minimize dangerous downcasting in subclasses.

        This method only calls the act() method if and only,

        • The sub class of Actor a is a SWActor, and
        • The SWActor is not dead
        else this method does nothing.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ActionInterface
        Specified by:
        execute in class Action
        Parameters:
        a - a sub class of Actor
        See Also:
        SWActionInterface.act(SWActor), SWActor.isDead()
